references.paper_title: On semiamarts, amarts, and processes with finite value
references.reason: This paper is foundational in the theory of optimal stopping problems and sequential decision-making, which is the basis of the prophet inequality discussed in this paper.

references.paper_title: Comparison of threshold stop rules and maximum for independent nonnegative random variables
references.reason: This paper provides the classic result of the prophet inequality, showing that simple threshold policies can achieve a tight 1/2-approximation to the optimal prophet value.
This paper extends the prophet inequality to all matroid constraints, providing a broader theoretical framework for optimal stopping problems.

references.paper_title: Bayes correlated equilibrium and the comparison of information structures in games
references.reason: This paper provides the foundational framework for Bayesian persuasion, which is the key theoretical model for strategic reward signaling discussed in this paper.
This paper introduces the concept of competition in persuasion, a key aspect of the strategic reward signaling setting studied in this paper.
